page.title: 12Stainforth and Keadby Canal
page.content: It acts as a link for South Yorkshire with the tidal waters of the Trent.At Keadby one finds a boat yard,a couple of public houses,South Yorkshire Inn and The Friendly Fox,and an electric swing bridge.The canal is also crossed by a unique railway drawbridge(Vazon Bridge)electrically operated by the signalman,which slides from side to side to allow vessels to pass along the waterway. The canal is still in use for many pleasurecraft some of their needs being met by the long established Keadby Marine Engineering Company situated on the coal bank at the basin.They undertake repairs and maintenance of boats and supply fuel,bottled gas and water.
